questiontext.text: When an enzyme changes shape and becomes non-functional due to factors like extreme pH and temperature, the enzyme is said to be
.....is the region of an enzyme where a substrate binds in a chemical reaction.
The highest temperature at which an enzyme maximizes its activity is called the ________________ temperature.
Enzyme activity stabilizes even when the concentration of substrate is increased. This is because most of the _________________ are occupied and cannot accomodate more chemical reactions.
What is a coenzyme?

answer.text: An ionic cofactor that interacts with an enzyme to allow it to work.
A protein cofactor that interacts with an enzyme to allow it to work.
A nonprotein organic cofactor that interacts with an enzyme to allow it to work.
An ionic cofactor that interacts with an enzyme to inhibit it.
A protein cofactor that interacts with an enzyme to inhibit it.

questiontext.text: What enzyme catalyzes hydrolysis reactions?
Please complete the following sentence:Combination of a protein and co-factor/co-enzyme is called a ______________.
Please fill answer below:The protein alone without a co-factor/co-enzyme is called an ______________.
The ionic interactions between the enzyme bound metal and the substrate can:

answer.text: Stabilise charged reaction states
Mediate oxidation-reduction reactions
Inhibit ezyme for reaction
All of the above

questiontext.text: Free fatty acids in the plasma

answer.text: Bind to fatty acid binding protein and circulated

questiontext.text: In what compartment does the de novo fatty acid synthesis occurs?
What is the precursor for fatty acid synthesis
The conversion of acetyl CoA to malonyl CoA is the rate limiting step in fatty acid synthesis. Which of the following enzyme catalyzes the above mentioned reaction?

The acetyl CoA is produced in the mitochondria and must be transported into cytosol for synthesis of fatty acid. Which of the following is true regarding its transport?

Asetil KoA dihasilkan dalam mitokondria dan harus diantarkan ke dalam sitosol untuk sintesis asam lemak. Yang manakah di bawah ini yang benar mengenai transport tersebut?

answer.text:
Acetyl CoA is diffused from mitochondrial membrane

Asetil KoA berdifusi dari membran mitokondria

Acetyl CoA is transported by its specific transporter protein

Asetil KoA diantarkan oleh protein transport khusus

Acetyl CoA is converted into pyruvate, enters into cytosol and acetyl CoA is regenerated

Asetil KoA dikonversi menjadi piruvat masuk ke dalam sitosol dan asetil KoA kemudian diregenerasikan

Acetyl CoA is converted into citrate, enters into cytosol and acetyl CoA is regenerated

Asetil KoA dikonversi menjadi sitrat, masuk ke sitosol dan asetil KoA diregenerasi

questiontext.text: ________packages the fat we consume and transports it from our small intestine to the liver.

__________transport cholesterol from the tissues of the body back to the liver through a process called reverse cholesterol transport, so the cholesterol can be eliminated in the bile.

......membawa kolesterol dari jaringan tubuh kembali ke hati melalui suatu proses yang disebut reverse cholesterol transport, sehingga kolesterol dapat dihancurkan di dalam empedu

__________transports cholesterol to the tissues of the body. It is therefore considered the "bad" cholesterol.

.......membawa kolesterol ke jaringan tubuh. Sehingga dianggap sebagai kolesterol "jahat"

Of the lipoprotein types produced by the liver, ______contains the highest amount of triglyceride. Because it contains a high level of triglyceride, having a high level means you may have an increased risk of coronary artery disease

Dari semua lipoprotein yang dihasilkan hati, ........mengandung trigliserida dalam jumlah paling tinggi. Karena mengandung trigliserida dalam jumlah paling tinggi, sehingga memilki zat ini dalam jumlah yang tinggi dapat meningkatkan resiko penyakit jantung koroner
Study the graph below. The graph shows the effect of what factor in enzyme activity?
Please fill answer below: Triacylglycerol (TAG) consists of 3 fatty acids (acyl chains) linked by _____ bonds to glycerol.

What vitamin or mineral do you recommend as a supplementation to avoid NTD in the baby?

A woman planning her pregnancy consulted you regarding what vitamins and minerals she should pay attention to during pregnancy, after reading in a website that deficiency of certain vitamins and minerals can result in developmental problems in the foetus, such as Neural Tube Defects (NTD).
Which of the following best describes the characteristics of lipid-soluble vitamins?

answer.text: Hydrophilic in nature
Does not require fats for absorption
Functions as a coenzyme in the body
Generally, cannot be stored as reserves

questiontext.text:
Zinc is a micromineral with many functions.

What is the main reason behind the WHO recommendation to provide zinc supplementation to children suffering from diarrhea?

Zinc adalah mineral mikro dengan banyak fungsi. Apakah alasan mengapa WHO merekomendasikan pemberian suplemen zinc untuk anak yang mengalami diare?

answer.text:
Because zinc plays a role in immunity and wound healing

Karena zinc memiliki peran dalam imunitas dan penyembuhan luka

Because zinc plays a role in the synthesis of the thyroxin hormone, which is crucial for child growth and development

Karena zincÂ berperan dalam sintesis hormon tiroksin, yang sangat penting untuk pertumbuhan dan perkembangan anak

Because zinc is essential for RBC synthesis

Karena zinc penting untuk sintesis sel darah merah

Because zinc is important for spermatogenesis

Karena zinc penting untuk spermatogenesis

Because zinc is required to neutralize free radicals

Karena zinc dibutuhkan untuk menetralkan radikal bebas

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a form of Vitamin D that is stored in the liver?
Deficiency of which mineral can lead to anemia?

As a solvent, water has the capability of solubilizing molecules of varying properties.

One certain molecule can result in the structure in the picture below. What kind of molecule is it?
What is a characteristic of water-soluble vitamins?

answer.text: Hydrophobic nature
Requires fats for absorption
Main function as hormone in the body
Generally, cannot be stored as reserves
Composed of hydrocarbon molecules called isoprene

In the degradation of red blood cells, heme will be converted into biliverdin and then bilirubin. Which enzyme converts heme into biliverdin?
Which of the following minerals play the biggest role in the coagulation cascade?
How is porphobilinogen formed?

answer.text: Through condensation of Succinyl Co-A
By condensation of two ALA molecules (alfa-aminolevulinate)
Through the decarboxylation of uroporphyrinogen III
By converting two propionate groups in coproporphyrinogen III into vinyl group
Through the chelation of Fe2+

questiontext.text: Which of the following coagulation factor is activated at the start of the common pathway?

Which of the following is a digestive enzyme commonly found in saliva?
Choose a correct statement regarding the ABO blood type:

answer.text: The O Blood type is a universal recipient
The A antigen contains an additional galactose moiety
Both A and B antigens are present on the red blood cell of AB types
The AB type can donate to all other types
The enzyme glycosyltransferase can be found in individuals with the O type

Yang manakah di bawah ini yang merupakan karakteristik protein globular

answer.text: Insoluble in water / Tidak larut di air
Thread like fibrils or long fibrils / Bentuknya seperti fibril
Have roles in metabolic reactions / Memiliki peran dalam reaksi metabolik
Long parallel polypeptide chains / Memiliki rantai polipeptida parallel panjang
